title: Directs NYSERDA to undertake a statewide study of consumer behaviors with respect to energy efficiency and clean energy technology
summary: Directs NYS energy research and development authority to undertake a statewide study of consumer behaviors with respect to energy efficiency and clean energy technology programs.

                                   I N  S E N A T E

       Introduced  by  Sen. MAZIARZ -- read twice and ordered printed, and when
         printed to be committed to the Committee on  Energy  and  Telecommuni-
         cations

       AN  ACT  directing  the  New  York State Energy Research and Development
         Authority to undertake a statewide study of  consumer  behaviors  with
         respect to energy efficiency and clean energy technology programs

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. 1. The New  York  State  Energy  Research  and  Development
    2  Authority  shall  undertake a statewide study of consumer behaviors with
    3  respect to energy efficiency and clean energy technology  programs.  The
    4  authority  may  contract  with an independent and competitively selected
    5  contractor to undertake such study. The authority shall prepare a report
    6  on its findings. On or before July 1, 2012, the authority shall transmit
    7  such report to the governor, the speaker of the assembly, the  temporary
    8  president  of  the  senate,  the  chairman of the assembly environmental
    9  conservation committee, ranking minority member of the assembly environ-
   10  mental conservation committee, the chairman of the senate  environmental
   11  conservation  committee,  ranking minority member of the senate environ-
   12  mental conservation committee,  the  chairman  of  the  assembly  energy
   13  committee, the ranking minority member of the assembly energy committee,
   14  the  chairman of the senate energy and telecommunications committee, the
   15  ranking minority member of  the  senate  energy  and  telecommunications
   16  committee,  the  chairman  of the assembly corporations, authorities and
   17  commissions committee, the  ranking  minority  member  of  the  assembly
   18  corporations, authorities and commissions committee, the chairman of the
   19  senate  corporations, authorities and commissions committee, the ranking
   20  minority member of the senate corporations, authorities and  commissions
   21  committee,  and  the  chairman of the assembly subcommittee on renewable

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets

    1  energy. The report shall also be made available to the  public  via  the
    2  authority website.
    3    2.  The  study  shall include, but not be limited to an examination of
    4  the following:
    5    a. The duration of any behavioral changes with respect to energy effi-
    6  ciency and clean energy practices and services including  a  comparative
    7  examination  of consumers who maintain energy efficiency practices after
    8  participation in energy efficiency and other clean energy  programs  and
    9  consumers  who  do not maintain such practices. In completing this exam-
   10  ination, the authority may  apply  social  science  theories  and  other
   11  applicable  methods  and  mechanisms to better understand, and thus have
   12  energy efficiency and clean energy programs replicate program strategies
   13  that result in sustainable behaviors;
   14    b. Behavioral change as a tool to improve the effectiveness of  energy
   15  efficiency  programs, including an examination of consumers that partic-
   16  ipate in energy efficiency and other clean energy programs, and  consum-
   17  ers who do not. In completing this examination, the authority may devel-
   18  op  program  strategies  and  recommendations through the application of
   19  insights from the behavioral sciences and/or behavior change  tools  and
   20  strategies  which  can  elicit different consumer motivations that drive
   21  energy-related decisions.   From such examinations,  the  authority  may
   22  make  program recommendations and implement program strategies that will
   23  help to improve program participation and consumer decision-making; and
   24    c. The impact of  market  prices  and  market  price  fluctuations  on
   25  consumer  choices  and  behavior  and the effect as a response to market
   26  based fluctuations to determine the impact this has on energy  conserva-
   27  tion efforts.
   28    3.  The authority shall consult with the department of public service,
   29  the power authority of the state of New  York,  the  Long  Island  power
   30  authority  and appropriate gas and electric corporations. The department
   31  of public service, the power authority of the state  of  New  York,  the
   32  Long  Island  power  authority  and  gas and electric corporations shall
   33  cooperate with the authority and its contractor  in  the  completion  of
   34  this study.
   35    4.  The  commissioner  of the department of environmental conservation
   36  shall provide for the transfer of $1,000,000 of revenues collected under
   37  direct oversight by the department of environmental  conservation,  from
   38  the  auction of any emissions allowances for air contaminants to the New
   39  York State Energy Research and Development Authority for the purposes of
   40  this act.
   41    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.
